column1: Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Internasional Sultan Mahmud Badarudin II) (IATA: PLM
column2: ICAO: WIPP) is an international airport serving the city of Palembang
column3: South Sumatra and surrounding areas. It is in the region KM.10 Sukarame District. It is named after Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin
column4: the last Sultan of Palembang. Effective 1 April 1991
column5: the airport is officially managed by the Management of Perum Angkasa Pura II. On January 2
column6: 1992 Management Perum Angkasa Pura II changed its status into PT (Persero) Angkasa Pura II. When South Sumatra Province was chosen as the host of PON XVI in 2004
column7: the government sought to enlarge the capacity of the airport as well as change the status into an international airport. New terminal building Airport Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II was completed and inaugurated on September 27
